external.title: Gribov Ambiguity and Stochastic Quantization (Master's Thesis)
external.supervisor: Prof. Laurent Baulieu, Sorbonne University, Paris & Dr. Vikash K. Ojha, SVNIT, Surat.
external.abstract: The Gribov problem arises from the absence of a global section in the Yang-Mills fiber bundle due to the configuration space's non-trivial nature. We studied the Yang-Mills configuration space, particularly the Gribov and Fundamental Modular Regions, and the semi-classical implementation of path integral restriction to the Gribov Region. Additionally, we also explored Stochastic Quantization, an alternative c-number quantization formalism offering gauge fixing in Yang-Mills theory without the Gribov Problem.
